channel.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

keep in mind im using an abstract source, so this code might not look like yours but.

note these lines:

[code]public int checkBankID=playerID;//default: playerID, can be set to any ID though, based on whose bank you would like to access. This code is NOT tested, though this is what i meant.

public void fromBank(int itemID, int fromSlot, int amount) {
	if (!IsBanking) {
		closeInterface();
		return;
	}
	if (amount > 0) {
		if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] > 0) {
			if (!takeAsNote) {
				if (Item.itemStackable[ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1]) {
					if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
						if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) {
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					} else {
						if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1),
								ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot])) {
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] = 0;
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					}
				} else {
					while (amount > 0) {
						if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) {
							if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) {
								ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1;
								amount--;
							} else {
								amount = 0;
							}
						} else {
							amount = 0;
						}
					}
					resetBank();
					resetItems(5064);
				}
			} else if (takeAsNote && Item.itemIsNote[ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot]]) {
				if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
					if (addItem(ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot], amount)) {
						ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
						resetBank();
						resetItems(5064);
					}
				} else {
					if (addItem(ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot], ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot])) {
						ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] = 0;
						ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0;
						resetBank();
						resetItems(5064);
					}
				}
			} else {
				sM("Item can't be drawn as note.");
				if (Item.itemStackable[ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1]) {
					if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] > amount) {
						if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), amount)) {
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] -= amount;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					} else {
						if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1),
								ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot])) {
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] = 0;
							ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] = 0;
							resetBank();
							resetItems(5064);
						}
					}
				} else {
					while (amount > 0) {
						if (ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] > 0) {
							if (addItem((ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItems[fromSlot] - 1), 1)) {
								ServerConstants.playerHandler.players[checkBankID].bankItemsN[fromSlot] += -1;
								amount--;
							} else {
								amount = 0;
							}
						} else {
							amount = 0;
						}
					}
					resetBank();
					resetItems(5064);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}[/code]

since my method is in my client, i can just let it add the items with addItem (no c. required)

This code gets the item from which ever bank is selected (via checkBankID) and removes that item from that bank.

is that better? :o

EDIT: i got it working
the Bank All was a little screwie due to the way it is set up but i got it working ^^’ can only withdrawl, not bank (to avoid accidental confusion), you right click them to check bank. once you open your bank via any method (other than ::bank) it will revert back to your bank. and while you are withdrawing from theirs, you can store it in yours. To make it work i didn’t have to add much other than what is above. Something in my packets class and i can remove the part from my commands(i had a command to revert it back to my bank, for my original design)

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:40, topic:393947”][code=java]if(playerCommand.startsWith(“checkbank”)) {
String name = playerCommand.substring(9);
Client player = null;
for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {
if(p != null) {
if(p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) {
player = p;
break;
}
}
}
if(player != null) {
//now set a variable in the client class: bankCheckingID

c.bankCheckingID = player.playerId;
c.inBank = true;
//then show their items
}
}
[/code]

then in the bankX packet handlers you can just add

Client player = PlayerHandler.players[c.bankCheckID]; if(player != null) { player.removeFromBank(item, amount, slot); //but you would still have to mess with that method to make it give the item to this player. }

So you’d have to make a new method

public void removeFromOtherBank(Client player, Client other, int item, int amount, int slot) { //remove from other's bank and add item to player. }[/quote]

that is what i said >.>’ (having to add another method) or…

player.removeFromBank(int item, amnt, slot)
//for remove it from player. but add item to Server.playerHandler.players[playerID])<-- instead of making the checkBank “null” when it is nobody else, make it your ID! and you can withdraw from your bank with the same method? :o just would take some reworking ^^’ I’ll work on the method to show what i mean if you need it.

Read full topic

[code=java]if(playerCommand.startsWith(“checkbank”)) {
String name = playerCommand.substring(9);
Client player = null;
for(Player p : PlayerHandler.players) {

player = p;
break;

}
if(player != null) {
//now set a variable in the client class: bankCheckingID

c.bankCheckingID = player.playerId;
c.inBank = true;
//then show their items
}
}
[/code]

then in the bankX packet handlers you can just add

Client player = PlayerHandler.players[c.bankCheckID]; if(player != null) { player.removeFromBank(item, amount, slot); //but you would still have to mess with that method to make it give the item to this player. }

So you’d have to make a new method

public void removeFromOtherBank(Client player, Client other, int item, int amount, int slot) { //remove from other's bank and add item to player. }
[/quote]
Conventions n_n[/quote]
wrote it in the reply box soo…

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You would have to explain that more, but i am curious how it knows who gets the item(s)… I know you would have a variable to tell you what their(or your) client id is(i think that is what you are getting at) and instead of it being null, should it just be your clientID#? (so you could just use Server.playerHandler.players[ID].(toBank/fromBank) and then you would have to send those items to the local user(you, the person taking the item) If i were to sit down and work it out that is probably how i would go about it.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

You’re over thinking it. You could just set a variable as the other player local then check if it’s null or not when you deposit and if it’s not null, then you remove that item from their bank.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:36, topic:393947”][quote author=matzie link=topic=491131.msg3975976#msg3975976 date=1334662654]

Online only, and I made it to work with right click (Admin’s can rightclick out of wildy to view banks, instead of “attack” option) This is being “accessed” from the client whose being checked, (the Client received is the one of who is checking) I just duped the resetBank() method and added the argument and the c.'s

public void showYourBank(Client c) { c.outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(53); c.outStream.writeWord(5382); // bank c.outStream.writeWord(playerBankSize); // number of items for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItemsN[i] > 254) { c.outStream.writeByte(255); c.outStream.writeDWord_v2(bankItemsN[i]); } else { c.outStream.writeByte(bankItemsN[i]); // amount } if (bankItemsN[i] < 1) { bankItems[i] = 0; } if ((bankItems[i] > 20000) || (bankItems[i] < 0)) { bankItems[i] = 20000; } c.outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(bankItems[i]); // itemID } c.outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.showInterface(5292); }

EDIT: to edit other peoples banks, i would add a “link bank” method in order to allow your commands to be sent to their bank. or you could “hijack” their client, though im not sure it would work lol.

Could just use the method that is given: takeFromBank(int item, int amount, int slot) and mess with some of the bankx packet handlers.

but the client would have to know its messing with oneone elses bank :3 so when interacting with the bank it does not try to remove it from yours with the usual (toBank fromBank) methods. it needs to know that it is in someone elses, explains my “link bank”

If the banking method is not in “client” it would have to receive two clients as arguments to be able to know both sides (checker,and being checked) Aside from that, it also would have to be split upon the button interface screen, (when you click an object, it sends the interface ID along with the button id) So you would have to tell it, if in person B’s bank(use this method)(rather than the original)
[/quote]
The client doesn’t need to know shit. The client only needs to know when to remove and add items to the bank or from the bank. We simply do that with the server-sided methods that have been poorly written. c2.bankItem(int item, int amount, int slot)[/quote]

client as in the class file, not as in the client it self…(it learns that stuff though resetBank() mostly–it resync’s all of the items) I figured you would know what i was talking about, considering were in the server help thread :o

EDIT: server tutorial thread, my bad. turns out this was posted in the wrong section… golf clap

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:35, topic:393947”][quote author=imsuperman05 link=topic=491131.msg3975468#msg3975468 date=1334612137]

Online only, and I made it to work with right click (Admin’s can rightclick out of wildy to view banks, instead of “attack” option) This is being “accessed” from the client whose being checked, (the Client received is the one of who is checking) I just duped the resetBank() method and added the argument and the c.'s

public void showYourBank(Client c) { c.outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(53); c.outStream.writeWord(5382); // bank c.outStream.writeWord(playerBankSize); // number of items for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItemsN[i] > 254) { c.outStream.writeByte(255); c.outStream.writeDWord_v2(bankItemsN[i]); } else { c.outStream.writeByte(bankItemsN[i]); // amount } if (bankItemsN[i] < 1) { bankItems[i] = 0; } if ((bankItems[i] > 20000) || (bankItems[i] < 0)) { bankItems[i] = 20000; } c.outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(bankItems[i]); // itemID } c.outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.showInterface(5292); }

EDIT: to edit other peoples banks, i would add a “link bank” method in order to allow your commands to be sent to their bank. or you could “hijack” their client, though im not sure it would work lol.

Could just use the method that is given: takeFromBank(int item, int amount, int slot) and mess with some of the bankx packet handlers.
[/quote]
but the client would have to know its messing with oneone elses bank :3 so when interacting with the bank it does not try to remove it from yours with the usual (toBank fromBank) methods. it needs to know that it is in someone elses, explains my “link bank”

If the banking method is not in “client” it would have to receive two clients as arguments to be able to know both sides (checker,and being checked) Aside from that, it also would have to be split upon the button interface screen, (when you click an object, it sends the interface ID along with the button id) So you would have to tell it, if in person B’s bank(use this method)(rather than the original)[/quote]
The client doesn’t need to know shit. The client only needs to know when to remove and add items to the bank or from the bank. We simply do that with the server-sided methods that have been poorly written. c2.bankItem(int item, int amount, int slot)

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:34, topic:393947”][quote author=matzie link=topic=491131.msg3975449#msg3975449 date=1334610949]
Online only, and I made it to work with right click (Admin’s can rightclick out of wildy to view banks, instead of “attack” option) This is being “accessed” from the client whose being checked, (the Client received is the one of who is checking) I just duped the resetBank() method and added the argument and the c.'s

public void showYourBank(Client c) { c.outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(53); c.outStream.writeWord(5382); // bank c.outStream.writeWord(playerBankSize); // number of items for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItemsN[i] > 254) { c.outStream.writeByte(255); c.outStream.writeDWord_v2(bankItemsN[i]); } else { c.outStream.writeByte(bankItemsN[i]); // amount } if (bankItemsN[i] < 1) { bankItems[i] = 0; } if ((bankItems[i] > 20000) || (bankItems[i] < 0)) { bankItems[i] = 20000; } c.outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(bankItems[i]); // itemID } c.outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.showInterface(5292); }

EDIT: to edit other peoples banks, i would add a “link bank” method in order to allow your commands to be sent to their bank. or you could “hijack” their client, though im not sure it would work lol.
[/quote]
Could just use the method that is given: takeFromBank(int item, int amount, int slot) and mess with some of the bankx packet handlers.[/quote]
but the client would have to know its messing with oneone elses bank :3 so when interacting with the bank it does not try to remove it from yours with the usual (toBank fromBank) methods. it needs to know that it is in someone elses, explains my “link bank”

If the banking method is not in “client” it would have to receive two clients as arguments to be able to know both sides (checker,and being checked) Aside from that, it also would have to be split upon the button interface screen, (when you click an object, it sends the interface ID along with the button id) So you would have to tell it, if in person B’s bank(use this method)(rather than the original)

Read full topic

EDIT: to edit other peoples banks, i would add a “link bank” method in order to allow your commands to be sent to their bank. or you could “hijack” their client, though im not sure it would work lol.[/quote]
Could just use the method that is given: takeFromBank(int item, int amount, int slot) and mess with some of the bankx packet handlers.

item.title: [317] Check Bank Command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Online only, and I made it to work with right click (Admin’s can rightclick out of wildy to view banks, instead of “attack” option) This is being “accessed” from the client whose being checked, (the Client received is the one of who is checking) I just duped the resetBank() method and added the argument and the c.'s

public void showYourBank(Client c) { c.outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(53); c.outStream.writeWord(5382); // bank c.outStream.writeWord(playerBankSize); // number of items for (int i = 0; i < playerBankSize; i++) { if (bankItemsN[i] > 254) { c.outStream.writeByte(255); c.outStream.writeDWord_v2(bankItemsN[i]); } else { c.outStream.writeByte(bankItemsN[i]); // amount } if (bankItemsN[i] < 1) { bankItems[i] = 0; } if ((bankItems[i] > 20000) || (bankItems[i] < 0)) { bankItems[i] = 20000; } c.outStream.writeWordBigEndianA(bankItems[i]); // itemID } c.outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord(); c.showInterface(5292); }

EDIT: to edit other peoples banks, i would add a “link bank” method in order to allow your commands to be sent to their bank. or you could “hijack” their client, though im not sure it would work lol.

Read full topic
